modules.name: machine_learning
recommendedLiterature: K.P. Murphy. Probabilistic Machine Learning: An Introduction. The MIT Press, 2022
I. Goodfellow, Y. Bengio, A. Courville. Deep Learning, The MIT Press, 2017
Additional material and articles provided in lecture notes
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Knowledge of probability and statistics, no attempted or completed IE 675 exam

modules.name: deep_learning
recommendedLiterature: I. Drori. The Science of Deep Learning. Cambridge University Press, 2023
I. Goodfellow, Y. Bengio, A. Courville. Deep Learning, The MIT Press, 2017
K.P. Murphy. Probabilistic Machine Learning: An Introduction. The MIT Press, 2022
K.P. Murphy. Probabilistic Machine Learning: Advanced Topics. The MIT Press, 2023
Additional material and articles provided in lecture notes
modules.additionalPrerequisite: No attempted or completed IE 674 exam

modules.name: advanced_process_mining
recommendedLiterature: Wil van der Aalst: Process Mining: Data Science in Action, 2nd edition (Recommended)
Josep Carmona et al. Conformance checking, 1st edition (Recommended)
Additional academic papers suggested per lecture
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Familiar with the use of Petri nets and BPMN for process modeling; Basic programming in Python; IS 515 or experience with process mining is not required

modules.name: web_data_integration_project
recommendedLiterature: AnHai Doan, Alon Halevy, Zachary Ives: Principles of Data Integration. Morgan Kaufmann, 2012
Luna Dong, Divesh Srivastava: Big Data Integration. Morgan & Claypool, 2015
Ulf Leser, Felix Naumann: Informationsintegration. Dpunkt Verlag, 2007

modules.name: web_mining_project
recommendedLiterature: Bing Liu: Web Data Mining. 2nd Edition, Springer, 2011
Wouter de Nooy, et al.: Exploratory Social Network Analysis with Pajek. 2nd Edition, Cambridge University Press, 2011
Bing Liu. Sentiment Analysis and Opinion Mining, Morgan & Claypool Publishers, 2012
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Programming skills in Java or Python

modules.name: large_language_models_and_agents
recommendedLiterature: Zhou et al.: A Comprehensive Survey on Pretrained Foundation Models: A History from BERT to ChatGPT. 2023.
Zhao et al.: A Survey of Large Language Models. 2024.
Wang et al.: A Survey on Large Language Model based Autonomous Agents. 2024.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Programming skills in Python; Basic machine learning concepts and techniques

modules.name: information_retrieval_project
recommendedLiterature: Christopher D. Manning, Prabhakar Raghavan and Hinrich Schütze, Introduction to Information Retrieval, Cambridge University Press. 2008.
B. Croft, D. Metzler, T. Strohman, Search Engines: Information Retrieval in Practice, Addison-Wesley, 2009.
R. Baeza-Yates, B. Ribeiro-Neto, Modern Information Retrieval, Addison-Wesley, 2011.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Programming skills in one of the higher-level programming languages: Java/Python/C#/C++.

modules.name: ai_applications_in_industry
recommendedLiterature: Various Scientific Publications – details in the lecture slides
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Machine Learning Concepts and Techniques; Programming in Python

modules.name: advanced_methods_in_text_analytics
recommendedLiterature: Dan Jurafsky and James H. Martin, Speech and Language Processing: An Introduction to Natural Language Processing, Computational Linguistics, and Speech Recognition (3rd edition, online available at https://web.stanford.edu/~jurafsky/slp3/)
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Fundamental notions of linear algebra and probability theory.

modules.name: foundations_and_applications_of_digital_health_technologies
recommendedLiterature: Fagherazzi, G. Deep Digital Phenotyping and Digital Twins for Precision Health: Time to Dig Deeper. Journal of Medical Internet Research 22, e16770 (2020).
Hahn, H. & Schreiber, A. E-Health. in Digital Transformation (ed. Neugebauer, R.) 311–334 (Springer Berlin Heidelberg, 2019).
Budd, J. et al. Digital technologies in the public-health response to COVID-19. Nat Med 26, 1183–1192 (2020).
Voeneky, S., P. Kellmeyer, O. Mueller, and W. Burgard, ed. 2022. The Cambridge Handbook of Responsible Artificial Intelligence: Interdisciplinary Perspectives. Cambridge Law Handbooks.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Basic knowledge about AI systems (knowledge-based systems, machine learning, deep neural networks)

modules.name: co_creating_digital_health_applications_with_design_methodology
recommendedLiterature: Fagherazzi, G. Deep Digital Phenotyping and Digital Twins for Precision Health: Time to Dig Deeper. Journal of Medical Internet Research 22, e16770 (2020).
Hahn, H. & Schreiber, A. E-Health. in Digital Transformation (ed. Neugebauer, R.) 311–334 (Springer Berlin Heidelberg, 2019).
Budd, J. et al. Digital technologies in the public-health response to COVID-19. Nat Med 26, 1183–1192 (2020).
Voeneky, S., P. Kellmeyer, O. Mueller, and W. Burgard, ed. 2022. The Cambridge Handbook of Responsible Artificial Intelligence: Interdisciplinary Perspectives. Cambridge Law Handbooks.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Basic knowledge about AI systems (knowledge-based systems, machine learning, deep neural networks)
